OOC: I want to apologize in advance for the length of this post, and
the fa=
ct that it is probably not one of my best. I am having to
squeeze in probab=
ly several weeks of battling back and forth into one
post, so for me it fee=
ls really rushed. But hopefully it will have
good results :)

BIC: 

The sk=
ies crackled around Decibel and the sweeps that were with her,
like a storm=
 brewing and exploding across the skies! Weapons fire
spewed out from her a=
nd the sweeps, forcing Hydras and his team to
back up slightly. With the fu=
ll force of her team of sweeps, Decibel's
fire power rains down on the trio=
 of Hydras, Perceptor and Darkhawk. 

Perceptor finds it difficult to actua=
lly target the sweeps directly as
their sensor-scattering armor makes them =
appear like ghosts to him,
visible only as they fire, and then disappearing=
 again. 

Meanwhile, somewhere in the midst of the battle Myrmidon holds of=
f the
sweeps that come at him, even as his self repair circuits quickly
bri=
ng him to a battle ready status! 

Jhiaxus slips through the skies, his stu=
rdy armor repelling all but
the strongest hits from the sweeps, and yet tho=
se few strikes are
beginning to tell on him as his armor is becoming slowly=
 whittled
away. With the loss of Tumult as a target he once again takes aim=
 at
the sweeps and begins the long and tedious process of taking them out
o=
f the skies a few at a time. He is remarkably effective at this, even
if it=
 does draw the attention of the sweeps to him. 

Below Scorponok holds his =
own, using his massive firepower to strike
in several different directions =
at once: fusion cannons, laser
batteries and his impressive physical streng=
th all work their power on
the sweeps that harry him like hyenas on some ma=
ssive black bear!

Shard's weaponry against the sweeps works well as severa=
l of them
explode in spectacular displays of fire, smoke and debris that
sc=
atters across the landscape. However even as he destroys several, it
seems =
that this army is never ending as more and more come to fill the
places of =
their fallen brethren.

Grimlock and Lord Elder find themselves hard presse=
d to stand firm
against the onslaught of the sweeps. Their numbers seem alm=
ost
overwhelming, even with the help of the shuttle. Without the ark, and
w=
ith Kup disappearing into the confines of that large black sphere
that cove=
rs the ark, there is little that they can do but attempt to
hold the lines =
against what would seem to be an unrelenting foe!

As they settle in to hol=
d their line, firing their weapons with
seeming abandon they realize it is =
not just against the sweep they
fight. Power and energy crackle once again =
as the power of Scourge,
Cyclonus' powerful and cagy second in command make=
s itself felt
against their defenses!

Meanwhile, inside that sphere of bla=
ckness around the Ark Kup and
Legacy are harried by the machine that floats=
 in the air. It fires
swiftly and then dodges with a grace the seekers of o=
ld would have
envied. Savage strikes hit the ground and the area around Leg=
acy and
Kup but they are ready to defend the Ark with their sparks if neces=
sary. 

Rodimus and Cyclonus on the other hand seem oblivious to everything=

but their battle and each other! Rodimus, the once leader of the
Autobots =
and ex-holder of the Matrix against Cyclonus, once second in
command of the=
 decepticons, now Unicron herald and new bearer of the
now corrupted matrix=
 - stand pitted against each other in a seeming
battle to the death!

Blows=
 and strikes fly through the air; as they move swiftly through a
dance of h=
its and feints, fists and laser cannons! Strike, hit =96 hit,
dodge, the so=
und of unrelenting metal striking unyielding armor rings
out over their sma=
ll battle field, and neither Cyclonus nor Rodimus
shows signs of falling.

=
Yet one must!

Rodimus takes one hit, and then another as Cyclonus opens up=
 what is
possibly one of the most powerful weapons in his arsenal =96 his b=
leed
back receptors. With a look almost of sorrow Cyclonus begins turning
t=
he very fury of Rodimus' weapons against him. His punches, kicks and
firepo=
wer seem to have little effect on Cyclonus as his palms glow and
the very p=
ower aimed at him is redirected and channeled against their
creator: Rodimu=
s!

Falling to one knee Rodimus looks at Cyclonus a smile spreading itself
=
across his cracked and pitted face. 

"You smile Rodimus? You have been bea=
ten. You cannot stand against me"
Cyclonus slowed, wary at this new tactic =
of his opponent. 

"I have not lost at all!" Rodimus snarled. As he struggl=
ed slowly to
his feet Rodimus' optics begin to glow as he gathers himself f=
or one
last assault. "It is you that has been defeated, by your own pride a=
nd
power!"

As if with an indrawn breath Rodimus fires an optic beam at Cyc=
lonus -
however instead of being its typical yellow or red it is black with=

tendrils of yellow running through it. It is not a laser, but
something el=
se. 

Reflexively Cyclonus reached up to block it and yet he was still
caug=
ht by it. It was not an attack, but instead it was a transmission!
The very=
 same code that was used to break down Rodimus' own
personality a few days =
ago, it is this same virus that Cyclonus has =96
by the power of his Bleedb=
ack receptors =96 allowed in to infect his
systems, almost without resistan=
ce. 

The effect on Cyclonus was immediate as his arms dropped to his sides=

as he and Rodimus locked gazes! Around them the sweeps seemed to
almost pa=
use as they could feel the infection spreading through their
leader. 

"NO!=
" a scream ripped out, not from Cyclonus but from Scourge as he
too could f=
eel the bond that held he and Cyclonus together being
ripped from his being=
! With a burst of energy he and several sweeps
tore through the battle line=
s, leaving their battle with Lord Elder
and Grimlock, as they flew to Cyclo=
nus' side - even as the minion
commander fell to his knees and slumped over=
!

"YOU!" Scourge raged at Rodimus, "You will die for this!"

Rodimus merel=
y smiled as he too fell to the ground, his own wounds and
the depletions of=
 his own reserves claiming his consciousness. 

Growling Scourge stepped ov=
er to his leader's fallen body as his
sensors pickup the faintest readings =
of life. Bending to one knee
Scourge looked down at Cyclonus, "Leader, you =
will live!" a small
smile traced itself across his face as he tried to pull=
 Cyclonus up. 

Cyclonus turned to face Scourge, his optics not the purple =
hue of
command but black and malevolent. With a viciousness they spewed out=

energy, much as Rodimus had fired, its power less then it was, but
still p=
otent. "No!" Scourge screamed out as he fell over, his systems
shutting dow=
n. 

Around them the battle raged, but without Cyclonus or Scourge to lead
=
it, the battle quickly became a route as the sweeps fell before the
combine=
d forces of Lord Elder and the Maximals as well as Hydras and
the forces he=
 led. 

Quickly the scene of the battle quiets leaving only the fallen
Cycl=
onus, Scourge and Rodimus at its core, the rest having either been
destroye=
d or fled!  Even the black sphere that was over the ark has
vanished, leavi=
ng only a black scortched earth around it, and a
harried yet not quite defe=
ated Legacy and Kup, standing ready to
defend the ark against a foe that is=
 now fled!

The battle is over!
